WorkItem.ClosedComment: Closing due to no feedback. If you get a freeze with sequence reconstruction open a new issue and please post the character xml and any needed changes to make it freeze.
WorkItem.Description: Character file attached. On the loading screen, it says "Done" for all three items but then becomes "not responding"; I have to end program in task manager to close it.

Comments.Message: Me neither, loaded it up in 2.3.0. Try unzipping your 2.3.0 again.

It's not consistently happening -- sometimes Rawr freezes on open, sometimes only after changing buffs. I was able to run Rawr in the debugger and get it to freeze; when I'd break into the code, then continue execution, then randomly break again, it was on line 289 of sequence.cs both times.

So I edited my character file to disable sequence reconstruction, and all seems to be well now...
I'm seeing the same problem.  Attached is my character file.

In current dev version I can't get your character to freeze. Is there any specific changes after loading the character that make it freeze? In general I would recommend not enabling sequence reconstruction unless you're using advanced solver as you probably won't get anything useful out of it anyway. I'm trying to fix these errors when I find them, but I need to know the exact reproduction steps in order to figure it out. The reconstruction process is very complex and it's not easy to verify correctness.
